job_tasks.phrase: evaluation, build, and applying tools in modernization projects, facilitating the usage of such tools and processes across the different project teams, identifying opportunities for tooling deployment, selecting potential 3rd party tools, contributing to the development of tooling prototypes and helping to shape the product roadmap.
job_tasks.justification: This phrase describes the process of evaluating, building, and applying tools, which are core software development activities. It also includes facilitating their usage and contributing to prototypes, indicating integration and development work.

job_tasks.phrase: Contribute to customer application modernization initiatives at any or all phases of the application lifecycle: assessment and analysis; planning and design; data modeling; application code conversion, development, test and build; integration and release configuration, production operations, application optimisation, and best practices adoption
job_tasks.justification: This sentence lists a comprehensive set of traditional software development lifecycle phases, including code conversion, development, testing, building, integration, and operations, all of which fall under Software Development & Integration.

job_tasks.phrase: Test drive MongoDB migration products to deliver on customer use cases and drive adoption of the product.
job_tasks.justification: Testing products and driving their adoption involves hands-on development and integration work to ensure they meet customer use cases.

job_tasks.phrase: Personally execute well-defined, outcome-focused projects, POC, MVP and everything in between.
job_tasks.justification: Executing projects, Proofs of Concept (POCs), and Minimum Viable Products (MVPs) are fundamental software development tasks.

job_tasks.phrase: POCs including developing or extending existing tools when necessary and appropriate for customer success, with an eye towards reusability and eventual integration with our products.
job_tasks.justification: This explicitly mentions developing and extending tools, with a focus on reusability and integration, which are core software engineering activities.

job_tasks.phrase: Maintain a broad and deep technical understanding of the product line and the underlying technologies and protocols
job_tasks.justification: While broad, maintaining technical understanding is foundational for effective software development and integration.

job_tasks.phrase: Work as part of a wider delivery team comprising consulting engineers from MongoDB Professional Services, project managers, and account teams
job_tasks.justification: Working within a delivery team that includes engineers implies a focus on the practical delivery of software solutions.

job_tasks.phrase: Work closely with Product and Engineering teams to influence the direction of the MongoDB product roadmap
job_tasks.justification: Influencing product roadmaps requires understanding business needs and strategic direction, aligning technical work with business goals.

job_tasks.phrase: Assist sales teams in evaluating opportunities with prospects and customers
job_tasks.justification: Assisting sales teams in evaluating opportunities involves understanding customer needs and how the product can solve their business problems.

job_tasks.phrase: Develop a playbook for customer application modernization engagements, in collaboration with other MongoDB Engineers, Product Management and Engineering
job_tasks.justification: Developing a playbook for customer engagements requires understanding business processes and translating them into actionable technical strategies.

job_tasks.phrase: Communicate complex technical proposals simply and convincingly to a wide range of audiences
job_tasks.justification: This directly addresses the ability to communicate technical information effectively to diverse audiences, a key aspect of communication skills.

job_tasks.phrase: Provide unique insight into customer needs, product requirements and strategic opportunities by contributing experience from the field
job_tasks.justification: Providing insights into customer needs and strategic opportunities demonstrates a strong business understanding and strategic thinking.

job_tasks.phrase: Gain the reputation as a trusted advisor with our field teams and customers
job_tasks.justification: Becoming a trusted advisor implies understanding customer business challenges and providing valuable, strategic guidance.

job_tasks.phrase: Contribute to the success of customer application migration initiatives that they support
job_tasks.justification: Contributing to the success of migration initiatives involves the practical application of software engineering skills to achieve customer business outcomes.

soft_skills.phrase: Communicate complex technical proposals simply and convincingly to a wide range of audiences
soft_skills.justification: This phrase directly describes the need for effective communication across different audiences.

soft_skills.phrase: Provide unique insight into customer needs, product requirements and strategic opportunities by contributing experience from the field
soft_skills.justification: This highlights the ability to understand customer needs and translate them into product requirements and strategic opportunities, which is a business understanding skill.

soft_skills.phrase: Gain the reputation as a trusted advisor with our field teams and customers
soft_skills.justification: Becoming a trusted advisor requires understanding business challenges and providing strategic guidance, aligning with business understanding.

profile.rationale: The job description heavily emphasizes traditional software engineering tasks (1.A.1) such as application modernization, code conversion, development, testing, integration, and working with tools and prototypes. While it mentions 'generative AI' and 'AI Engineer', the core responsibilities are focused on applying and integrating these technologies within customer modernization projects, rather than developing or fine-tuning AI models themselves (which would fall under Macro-Category B). The role is about using AI tools to facilitate software engineering tasks and customer engagements, making it an AI-Adjacent Software Engineer profile.

confidence.reasoning: The job ad is quite detailed regarding the software engineering aspects of the role, including the full application lifecycle and project execution. However, the specific AI/ML tasks are described more in terms of 'exploring possibilities' and 'applying tools' rather than deep model development. The mention of 'generative AI' is present but not the primary focus of the detailed responsibilities. This makes the classification as 'AI-Adjacent Software Engineer' strong, but not a perfect 5 due to the slight ambiguity in the depth of AI involvement.
